alert.note: Alert for Caddo; Cleveland; Comanche; Grady; McClain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 16 at 1:48PM CDT until March 16 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central Oklahoma and southwest Oklahoma, including the following counties, in central Oklahoma, Cleveland, Grady and McClain. In southwest Oklahoma, Caddo and Comanche. * WHEN...Until 445 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 148 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southern Oklahoma City, Norman, Moore, Chickasha, Newcastle, Blanchard, Noble, Slaughterville, Elgin, Goldsby, Apache, Fletcher, Cyril, Dibble, Washington, Cole, Alex, Cement, Amber and Norge. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
